alert.note: Alert for Southern High Plains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 11 at 1:49AM MST until January 11 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM EARLY THIS MORNING TO 11 AM MST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 PM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 55 below zero. * WHERE...Southern High Plains. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 5 PM MST this afternoon. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 5 AM early this morning to 11 AM MST Friday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 5 PM this afternoon to 5 PM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
